attributes.action: Ryanair should issue refunds for areas the FCO say are 'essential travel only'
attributes.additional_details: It is not fair top expect people to be out of pocket by hundreds of pounds for not going to a place where the FCO have said their is a potential risk to life and only essential travel should take place. Airlines should not be flying to these places unless it is for humanitarian needs.
attributes.background: If the FCO sate that an area should only be visited for essential travel only, then Ryanair (or any other airline) should issue refunds to passengers who have booked to go to those areas, or else they will be flying them into danger zones.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Require airlines cancel flights to places the FCO has advised against travel to: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333773

Create a fund to reimburse money lost due to covid-19 travel: cancellations: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304912
